interlinear-text.item: ELA A miracle for Bobo Sufi's family [3]

phrase.item: This story told by Wakhi people is about Bobo Sufi.
When Bobo Sufi came to Avegarch [village] to stay, he had a lot of wealth and many flocks.
However, he didn't have any children.
One day Bobo Sufi went to another village for some work.
In the evening when he returned to Avegarch, he saw that all his flocks were scattered everywhere.
He called his wife, he called her name, saying, "Hey, where are you?"
At that moment, a miracle occurred for his wife.
A person came and asked his wife if Bobo Sufi was at home.
So the wife replied, "I have everything, I have wealth, but one thing is lacking."
[And the stranger] said, "Whatever is lacking here..." and he gave her a bowl, saying, "Take this bowl and go to the spring and drink as much water as you can."
Maybe the =t is not 2sg in the fronted relative but rather the conjunction. The main verb is non-past.
Bobo Sufi's wife went to the spring and with that bowl she drank two and a half cups [of water].
When Bobo Sufi came, he saw that his flocks were scattered everywhere. Then he called his wife and asked, "Why? What?"
Come here, I have produced for you two sons and a daughter."
So then Bobo Sufi grew very happy.
And when he came home, his wife told him in detail about the miracle that had happened.
